results.content: The course covers basic key concept of Laravel framework. It also has good project to work on to learn the framework. However, the catalogue is confusing and mixed with Laravel 6. The Laravel 8 catalogue is on-going catalogue (not finished syllabus). Other than that, there is so many copy and paste development style, instead of code reusing with single template or code. Overall, it helps me to understand the basics of Laravel. I hope the instructor can show how to produce more beautiful code structure/design pattern. Thank you.
results.content_html: The course covers basic key concept of Laravel framework. It also has good project to work on to learn the framework. However, the catalogue is confusing and mixed with Laravel 6. The Laravel 8 catalogue is on-going catalogue (not finished syllabus). Other than that, there is so many copy and paste development style, instead of code reusing with single template or code. Overall, it helps me to understand the basics of Laravel. I hope the instructor can show how to produce more beautiful code structure/design pattern. Thank you.

results.content:
I just wanted to say a big thank you for this course.  I haven't finished it yet because I'm implementing the things Ive learned in a couple of different live projects that I have on the go.

It suddenly dawned on me though just how much i've learned by following your course.  My understanding and skill with Laravel has significantly improved and for that I want to express my gratitude.

The thing I think that has helped me more than anything is that you keep the video rolling when an error comes up on the screen... even if its only a typo ( which lets face it, it so often is) you still work through it and show us how to get to the bottom of these errors.

In my world this is priceless - as a student there is nothing more frustrating than following a video along and everything works on their screen but on my screen I have an error - it infuriates me as I don't know how to solve it

I have not experienced that with your course at all and I just want to let you know - great job! Highly recommended
results.content_html:
I just wanted to say a big thank you for this course. I haven't finished it yet because I'm implementing the things Ive learned in a couple of different live projects that I have on the go.

It suddenly dawned on me though just how much i've learned by following your course. My understanding and skill with Laravel has significantly improved and for that I want to express my gratitude.

The thing I think that has helped me more than anything is that you keep the video rolling when an error comes up on the screen... even if its only a typo ( which lets face it, it so often is) you still work through it and show us how to get to the bottom of these errors.

In my world this is priceless - as a student there is nothing more frustrating than following a video along and everything works on their screen but on my screen I have an error - it infuriates me as I don't know how to solve it

I have not experienced that with your course at all and I just want to let you know - great job! Highly recommended

results.content: Hard to understand the instructor,  Course is not well structured.  I was expecting to build an eCommerce site from scratch as the title of the course mentions but this is not the case.  when you get to the section to start the project instructor already has some of the Migrations all ready in place and an Admin controller created with Login and register working. there is a separate section on authentication but it's complete decoupled from the project.

results.content:
MVC pattern (Model View Controller) is not used in the proper way the course is full of bad practices, for example, the views of the page a full of business logic that is not allowed in modern development, using row SQL for every query regardless of the complicity of the code end not using Models and eloquent in not aloud in MVC pater, creating two tables for category and subcategory and not using parent_id it is wrong what will happen if I wont to add a subcategory for the subcategory nested one in one-word bed solution, the main reason that people bay the courses are to learn to code and get good coding practices to write clean and scalable code the is easy to maintain not like this hen in one-word bed tutorial 
One good thing is the app has all the necessary modules for e-commerce
results.content_html:
MVC pattern (Model View Controller) is not used in the proper way the course is full of bad practices, for example, the views of the page a full of business logic that is not allowed in modern development, using row SQL for every query regardless of the complicity of the code end not using Models and eloquent in not aloud in MVC pater, creating two tables for category and subcategory and not using parent_id it is wrong what will happen if I wont to add a subcategory for the subcategory nested one in one-word bed solution, the main reason that people bay the courses are to learn to code and get good coding practices to write clean and scalable code the is easy to maintain not like this hen in one-word bed tutorial
One good thing is the app has all the necessary modules for e-commerce

results.content: To be very honest, this tutor's English is awful. And unnecessary extending the length of videos. Many of the videos are very lengthy, when they could have been very precise and to the topic. I had to watch videos in 2x speed, still I felt that my progress was very slow, because while the tutor was thinking that he is explaining something, in actual he was just switching from one file to another and nothing else. While writing this review, I am watching video #89 and he has not used anything related to Laravel 8. Actually PHP function instead of Laravel function to upload images. Weird. I really wanted a refund, but before figuring that he has not taught anything related to Laravel 8, I actually watched a lot of videos and therefore cant refund now.

response.content: Hi Aryan Most probably you are the first one who told i speak too slow. Coz every one says i speak too fast. It’s means i can’t happy everyone. This course is created by laravel 6 which i have told in my intro video. but lots of students ask me to update this course. So i have added some sections of laravel 8. and step by step i will update this total project also. this is one of the most interactive laravel course in udemy. Just let me know if there have any laravel 8 course content like this in udemy? I have created this for beginners to advance. So plz don’t compare everyone with your level.Let me know what i have missed in laravel 8? I have put lots of effort to build this type of course so plz don’t judge so quickly my friend.
